summary: This is an email chain from April 26, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff discussing the preparation of an update memo on the Jeffrey Epstein case for an upcoming meeting. The emails focus on coordinating edits, incorporating information about the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) suit and Florida victims litigation, and assigning tasks.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: The final version of an update memo on the Epstein case is prepared for her, as indicated by the attachment filename '2019-04-26JE_status_memo_for Audrey.v2.docz'.

events.title: Scheduled meeting on Epstein case
events.description: A person (initials redacted) is scheduled to meet with another individual on Monday regarding the Epstein case, prompting the request for an update memo.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively working on the Jeffrey Epstein case in April 2019, preparing status updates.
The update memo needed to cover the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) suit and litigation involving victims from Florida, indicating these were active legal matters related to the case.
The email chain shows internal coordination and task delegation among prosecutors or staff attorneys, with several names redacted.
The communication was for internal preparation ('just for [redacted] for now, not for sending down to DC'), suggesting updates were being prepared for senior officials or meetings within the office.
